alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 1:28PM MST until June 26 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE FIRE SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 124 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire scar earlier today. Light to moderate rain continues over the Pipeline scar. Between 1 and 2 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding has been reported along Highway 89 and in Wupatki Trails. Flooding has also closed Highway 89 near Sunset Crater. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar, automated gauges, and reports from law enforcement and local officials. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Timberline, Sunset Crater Visitors Center and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 426 and 436. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
